code.display: Generalized anxiety disorder 7 item (GAD-7)

extension.valueString:
The Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) is a seven-item instrument that is used to measure or assess the severity of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). Each item asks the individual to rate the severity of his or her symptoms over the past two weeks.

These questions are to be answered by the patient.

code.display: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge

item.text: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks have you not been able to stop or control worrying

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks have you not been able to stop or control worrying

code.display: Worrying too much about different things

item.text: Worrying too much about different things

code.display: Trouble relaxing

item.text: Trouble relaxing

code.display: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still

item.text: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still

code.display: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable.

item.text: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable.

code.display: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

item.text: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

code.display: Generalized anxiety disorder 7 item total score

item.text: Generalized anxiety disorder 7 item total score

code.display: PHQ-9 quick depression assessment panel [Reported.PHQ]
Little interest or pleasure in doing things

item.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

code.display: Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless

item.text: Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless

code.display: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much

item.text: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much

code.display: Feeling tired or having little energy

item.text: Feeling tired or having little energy

code.display: Poor appetite or overeating

item.text: Poor appetite or overeating

code.display: Feeling bad about yourself-or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down

item.text: Feeling bad about yourself-or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down

code.display: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television

item.text: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television

code.display: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite-being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual

item.text: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite-being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual

code.display: Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way

item.text: Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way

code.display: How difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?

item.text: How difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
If you checked off any problems on this questionnaire

code.display: Patient health questionnaire 9 item total score

item.text: Patient health questionnaire 9 item total score

The PHQ-9 is the standard (and most commonly used) depression measure, and it ranges from 0-27 Scoring: Add up all checked boxes on PHQ-9. For every check: Not at all = 0; Several days = 1; More than half the days = 2; Nearly every day = 3 (the scores are the codes that appear in the answer list for each of the PHQ-9 problem panel terms). Interpretation: 1-4 = Minimal depression; 5-9 = Mild depression; 10-14 = Moderate depression; 15-19 = Moderately severe depression; 20-27 = Severed depression.
